intro: Carex filipes subsp. rouyana, commonly known as the slender filiform sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and compact inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikes, typical of the sedge family. The subspecies rouyana is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and habitat preferences compared to the main species.
